entry.title: Using the WordPress Visual Editor
entry.content:
The visual editor provides a semi-WYSIWYG (What You See is What You Get) content editor that allows you to easily create, edit, and format your blog content in a view similar to that of a word processor. Here are some sites that I believe provide useful information to get started with the WordPress visual editor:

14 Tips for Mastering the WordPress Visual Editor

This is one of the more detailed walkthroughs of the WordPress visual editor that I’ve found.


21 Most Usefule Time Saving WordPress Shortcuts

This post is for you if you would prefer not to have to keep reaching for your mouse for basic formatting.


The Official WordPress Visual Editor Instructions

I’m including this link more as an honorable mention. Most of WordPress.org’s documentation is fantastic, so don’t let this discourage you.


Page Builder Alternatives/Additions

  • Page Builder by Site Origin
  • Beaver Builder

entry.title: Creating Menus in WordPress
entry.content:
Do you want to add navigation menus in your WordPress site? Did you know that there is a very easy drag-and-drop menu interface that allows you to create drop-down menus in WordPress. In this step by step guide, we will show you how to add navigation menu in WordPress.
